1.title: The Making of Q*bert

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

1.plot: The creator of Q*Bert, Jeff Lee teams up with longtime Gottlieb employee Tom Malinowski to discuss various Gottlieb arcade video games.

2.title: Sonic Theme Music

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

2.plot: Johnny Gioeli is the voice behind the theme songs from the Sonic The Hedgehog video game series starting in 1998 with Sonic Adventure for the Dreamcast. Since then, Johnny has been involved with writing and performing songs for the majority of the Sonic releases since then. Join him as he discusses his history with the series.

3.title: Mortal Kombat

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

3.plot: Daniel Pesina was the person behind many iconic characters in Mortal Kombat - Sub Zero, Scorpion, Reptile and Johnny Cage. Join him, Phillip Ahn M.D. and Alfredo Sanchez as they discusses what it was like behind the scenes, making one of the most iconic arcade fighting games of all time.

4.title: NES Homebrews

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

4.plot: VGBS Gaming Podcast is back at the Midwest Gaming Classic and this time they are talking about the current NES Homebrew revolution. With over 500 brand new Nintendo games out that many haven't heard about, and games coming out all the time, Jeffrey Wittenhagen and Kyle Gilbert are going to talk about our favorites and go into details on how you can join in on the fun.

5.title: Stern Pinball 2017

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

5.plot: Gary Stern was born into the coin-operated industry, and today is the president of Stern Pinball, the largest pinball manufacturer in the world. Find out what's been going on with the company since last year and what's in store for the future.

6.title: Dark Presence Arcade Game

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

6.plot: Doc Mack of Galloping Ghost Productions presented the arcade fighting game Dark Presence. Giving some insight on the development of the game and plans he has for it in the near future.

7.title: Retronaughts LIVE - Splatterhouse

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

7.plot: Retronauts mainstays Bob Mackey and Jeremy Parish break down the history of Namco's grisly Splatterhouse series with the help of no less than two Splatterhouse world-record competitors: Caitlin Oliver and Kevin Bunch. It's splatter-riffic.

8.title: My Life in Games

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

8.plot: Ed Fries is covering the history of the game business from the beginning up until the present and mixes in his own involvement at various points including when he led the team to launch the original Xbox. Find out what Ed is now involved in, including improving diversity in the game business, video games as works of art, and the importance of documenting the story of the business.

9.title: Deathstalker Arcade Game

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

9.plot: Brian Colin has been in the arcade scene for many years and is responsible for some iconic games including Rampage, Arch Rivals, Xenophobe and Pigskin 621 AD. Now, together with Galloping Ghost Productions, Brian will be discussing the unreleased 1985 gem The Spectre Files: Deathstalker.

10.title: Midwest YouTubers

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

10.plot: Join the guys behind the YouTube gaming channels Grimsie42, Retro Games Vinyl and Beer, The Old A** Retro Gamer, The Game Grinder, and Bawesome Burf as they discuss how they got onto YouTube, their thoughts on gaming, and take questions from the audience.

11.title: 2015 Nintendo World Champioship Midwest Qualifiers

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

11.plot: When Nintendo decided to run an updated version of their Nintendo World Championship in 2015, Tim Hanson and Chris Bidwell won the right to represent the Midwest in the competition. Tim and Chris will share stories about winning their respective regional tournaments, share tips on how to achieve high scores on NWC Remix, and relive the drama of the finals at E3 in Los Angeles.

12.title: The Art of ATARI

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

12.plot: The Art of Atari video games was truly stunning, and Tim Lapetino does an amazing job capturing this unique era in video game history. The images are beautiful, and so is Tim's book by the same name, which features page upon page of Atari's art, while showcasing some of the stories behind it.

13.title: Building Cen64

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

13.plot: Tyler Stacheki and Mike Ryan discuss how they make the Cen64 emulator fast without compromising on accuracy.

14.title: The Nintendo Playstation Strikes Back

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

14.plot: In 2016, Terry and Dan Diebold showed off the Nintendo Playstation prototype for the first time in the United States at the Midwest Gaming Classic. A lot has happened since last year, and the Diebolds along with Ben Heck will update you on what has gone on, where they have been, and more.

15.title: Gizmo's Pitch & Bat Games

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

15.plot: Jeremy Packer, Thomas Taylor and Paul Reno of Gizmo Games briefly discuss developing pitch and bat games in the modern era.

16.title: Secrets of Dragon's Lair & Space Ace

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

16.plot: From Dirk the Daring and Ace, to Ariel the Mermaid and much more. Philo is perhaps best known for other projects he helped animate - Beauty and the Beast, The Rescuers Down Under, The Secret of NIMH, Happily Ever After, An American Tail, and special effects for Star Trek: The Motion Picture. Philo is joined by Charles D. Moisant, a comic book artist, writer and the creative director of Silver Phoenix Entertainment where the two work together on new projects.

17.title: Watch Out for Fireballs LIVE - Pilotwings

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

17.plot: Watch Out for Fireballs. is a game club podcast that focuses on retro games hosted by Gary Butterfield and Kole Ross. For the Midwest Gaming Classic, they talk everything Pilotwings for the Super Nintendo. It's a very strange, sedate, and pleasant game that's often overlooked in Nintendo's history.

18.title: 2017 Midwest Tetris Championship Finals

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

18.plot: Join the final four competitors in the Midwest Gaming Classic Tetris tournament as they play head-to-head on the big screen in the Speaker Area to prove their Tetris dominance. The final rounds are played using the head-to-head variation of the game on the SNES.

19.title: 2017 N64 Super Smash Bros Tournament

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

19.plot: This is it, the last episode of season 2!. Out of 32 contestants, 4 are left to compete in the Wisconsin N64 Super Smash Bros Tournament. Who will win? Watch all the action to find out!.

1.title: Show Introduction

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

1.plot: Midwest Gaming Classic co-founder Dan loosen explains the origin of the convention and provides a brief tour.

2.title: Argus Arcade Game

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

2.plot: Jeff Lee and Tom Malinowski discuss the development and history of the very rare Gottlieb arcade game Argus.

3.title: Designing the Atari 2600

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

3.plot: Joe Decuir and Marty Goldberg discuss the development behind the legendary Atari VCS / 2600 home video game console.

4.title: Early Atari and Amiga Computer Engineering

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

4.plot: Joe Decuir along with Marty Goldberg talk about early Atari and Amiga computer engineering that took place in the early 1980s.

5.title: Pinball Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

5.plot: Gary Stern of Stern Pinball discusses the three different editions of pinball machines they manufacture for each game produced, who they've been marketing them to, what demographics he'd like to see play them and the future of the hobby.

6.title: Creating Ghostbusters Pinball

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

6.plot: John Trudeau, Jeremy Packer and Dwight Sullivan discuss how the three of them designed the Ghostbusters Pinball machine for the Stern Pinball company.

7.title: A Brief History of Pinball

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

7.plot: Don Caldwell and Mark Bakula give a quick history of pinball through the years. From the origin of the game, it's advancements, where it is today and ending with recognizing some of the artists.

8.title: Nintendo PlayStation

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

8.plot: The Nintendo PlayStation was found and it's first appearance in the United States was at the 2016 Midwest Gaming Classic. Jeremy Parish, Dan and Terry Diebold discuss the discovery of the system and their journey up to that point.

9.title: SEGA Master System

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

9.plot: The guys from the Retronauts podcast along with two Sega Master System historians discuss and explain the history of the Sega Master System home gaming console.

10.title: Video Game Culture Chronicles 1990

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

10.plot: Jeffrey Wittenhagen and Kyle Gilbert of the VGBS podcast discuss the year 1990 in their Video Game Culture Chronicles at the 2016 Midwest Gaming Classic convention.

11.title: Cosplay Contest

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

11.plot: Spooky Pinball and Bright Eyes Cosplay team up for the 2016 edition of the Midwest Gaming Classic cosplay contest.

12.title: Bonus Level

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

12.plot: A Q&A session with Joe Decuir, outtakes with Dan Loosen and Beaker's live performance of their trademark song "Squirrel Killer" finishes off season 1.

1.title: A Journey Through SEGA's Past

episode of.title: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (TV Series 2017– )

1.plot:

akas: Stories from the Midwest Gaming Classic (United States)
plot: A documentary series that showcases panels from the Midwest Gaming Classic convention.
